comment: Makes a difficult subject as straightforward as possible by having the review days be EXACTLY what's on the test. Very caring and compassionate teacher, will do anything to help you understand and get the grade you want. Lectures may be tough but with some studying and those in-class review days you'll manage fine with a great teacher.

The lectures always left me more confused afterwards. His teaching style seemed like he was confused and couldn't align his instruction with what the homework assignments wanted us to do. The only way I started passing tests was by skipping the lectures and teaching myself through the textbook.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Stay FARRR away from this professor if you want to actually learn anything. He rushes through the material and barely takes the time to explain the concepts clearly. The pace is way too fast, leaving most of the class mate confused.  If you're looking for a class where you'll be able to understand and succeed, this isn't it.

Professor cares about his students and wants them to be successful. I have taken this Professor before and highly recommend taking him. He gives you enough materials in understanding the curriculum. Study guides reflected the exams, so do them. There are no surprises , take his courses before it fill up.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is amazing with communication, but does not help with the difficulty of the class. THIS CLASS IS NOT EASY. Some of the questions on homework and tests took so long to answer due to all of the steps that I never fully completed a single test. HW takes hours and the lecture notes are not efficient in teaching how to solve the problems.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: This instructor does not provide extensions for emergencies. Very rude feedback rather than constructive criticism. Very degrading responses from him if you find yourself struggling.

This course was extremely difficult since math isn't my strongest subject but Professor Santillan is AMAZING! It's algebra, you HAVE to put in the work. He gives out many great extra credit opportunities so do it guys! A lot of aleks is included and you have to teach yourself, so be ready. AMAZING PROFESSOR!

The professor is very kind, however the class was A LOT of work. The lectures did not personally help me, so I was left to teach myself all of the topics by doing the homework. The homework was weekly and 50+ lengthy questions that took me hours. Tests were in class on lockdown browser, and identical to the study guide. Final exam was open note!

Professor Santillan was very interactive with the students and consistently provided great study guides for testing. He truly cares about his students and was one of the best instructors I have ever had. Math is a really tough subject - he made it understandable. Best Professor I have ever had.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Just don't take the class if you want to have to teach yourself, he makes you calculate your grade yourself, and when going over the study guide he avoids your questions unless it's beneficial to him sometimes. Also the test are on ALEKS so as long as you do the study guides on aleks you'll be good.

I am normally pretty decent at math, but the class was difficult for me. It seemed that only half of the class understood the material, and the other half tried to keep up. He talks very quickly with an accent, and he also explains concepts very quickly. If you can keep up with him, you'll be okay. I don't recommend for slower or thorough learners.

he is such an amazing math teacher!! i have taken him for 2 classes and i love the way his classes are set up. it is just homework, ungraded study guides, and tests. the tests are EXACTLY like the study guide so don't skip them!! this class is easy but he helped make it even easier.

This professor has a thick accent but is very funny and has an enjoyable class. He takes attendance but has not counted against you for all I know. I got almost a 100 in this class, by just reviewing the study guides. The study guides have the exact test questions on it with just different numbers. recommend this class!!!!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: So nice! His accent really isn't a problem, despite what some people have said on here. His lectures are clear, he provides support outside of mandatory hours, and he's an overall kind person. You can really tell he's passionate about math, too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I love him!! He was so kind and always answered my emails. I remember I made a mistake once on my exam and he allowed me to go over time to fix it. He is caring and I appreciate the way his lectures were set up.

I took this as an 8 am class, which was rough but there was only like a few people in the whole class. He is very engaging and has longer lectures but if you take notes and pay attention, you should do fine. The course material is iffy.

I could've gotten a better grade in this class if I paid attention more, but I was working and I was bogged down by four other classes in the summer.

Overall great professor!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I probably couldve definitely got a better grade in this class if I took the time to study the material at hand but I work full time. The lectures can be lengthy but as long as you take notes and properly study then you should be fine. His homework is really what helped my score, but he's really nice and really wants the best for you.

Hes the best math teacher Ive had!!! If you do your part, youll get an A. He explain everything and wont care if you ask again. He allows you to do your study guide, which I believe its a great help. Ive never been good at math, but his method is very good. So you will actually learn and get a good grade.

I really enjoyed this professor. He is so sweet and the tests are exactly like the study guides he gives. The class overall was pretty easy but if you struggle in math then stay on top of notes and the homework practice and you should be fine.
He has a very thick accent which makes it hard to understand. I taught myself most of the material because his lectures are unclear most times. The test are based off the homework and studyguides.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved having his as a math prof. He cared about your grades enough and responds to emails. He goes through the tests and quizzes before posting the grades because he knows the computer can be weird about responses, and most of the time you get points added back. He really tries to help his students and do applicable problems. His accent is thick.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This was the easiest class I took for the summer. He was very clear when he told us the study guides are just like the tests, and they are. It'd be hard for someone to fail if they just did the study guides. Just participate in the class and do the study guide and you'll be just fine

He is a really good professor! Take him! His tests have similar questions on the study guide and he goes over the study guide in class. If you know how to do the study guide, you know how to do the test. If your participate in class he is more likely to bump your grade at the end of the semester. Also go to SI sessions. It is hard to fail this clas

Honestly am not sure on all the negative comments on this professor. Took him over the summer online and was way easier than expected. Only used ALEKS, study guides were the test. I think the ones that left negative comments on this professor are just people that didn't do the study guides. He makes it almost impossible for you not to make an A.

This prof. does not play when it comes to this class. I enjoyed his teaching methods and learned quite a bit from his course, but you will need to work for that A. He does not record lectures and makes attendance mandatory. The good thing is that he sets you up for success by allowing you to use a study guide during his tests. Very nice but strict
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He lets you use the study guide on the exam. You have homework every week, basically. Do the homework and complete the study guide. However, be very careful about the final. You cannot use the study guide on the final. This cost me in the end because I had not memorized the steps for all the problems since they had been on my study guide previously
Great professor! If you attend class regularly, complete the study guides you are ready to go! Definitely take him, easy class!
Very helpful and nice. Clearly wants his students to succeed so does everything to make our lives easier. Would definitely take him again.
Has a heavy accent which is hard to understand sometimes. He goes over the material and then does examples for most lectures. He was not that bad. He uses Aleks which gets really time consuming.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Hes honestly not that bad, but he does have a heavy accent. Besides that, he gives sooo much extra credit & if you have few absences you also get extra credit on the final. He also curves some tests so its honestly harder to fail than to pass. Passed with a 95.

He has a very strong accent that is hard to understand, especially at the beginning of the semester, but his English is good. His grades come from the weekly homework on ALEKS and 5 tests. He wants his students to do well but does not always execute lessons well. He will either curve the test or offer an extra credit assignment.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Prof JS is from Mexico. His english is fine but he can be difficult to understand/have difficulty understanding your questions at times. The homework and tests are online which is only frustrating when he doesn't know what the online platform is asking us. But other than that he is friendly and can be somewhat ditsy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT
